sectionConfigJson.title: Turning **today's heart disease** into **tomorrow's heart health.**
What is Heart Hive?
sectionConfigJson.blurb:
Heart Hive is a simple way for patients and researchers to partner together so that research happens faster and tomorrow's cures are discovered sooner.

On Video: Learn more about the Heart Hive and how you can join as a patient data donor.

sectionConfigJson.title: Eligibility
sectionConfigJson.blurb:
You are eligible to join Heart Hive if you meet **any one of these criteria:**

* People with a diagnosis of cardiomyopathy or myocarditis

* People who have a family history of cardiomyopathy

* People whose genetic testing reveals they have inherited risks for cardiomyopathy

*If you've already registered on our old website, please wait for us to contact you about migrating your account*

steps.blurb: People living with or at risk of myocarditis or cardiomyopathy sign up on the website.
Participants enter their own health data in a short questionnaire.
Participants gain access to research projects and self-enroll in studies that interest them.

sectionConfigJson.title: Data control and privacy
sectionConfigJson.blurb:
**You remain in control.** You always have a choice about how your data is used and which researchers will be given access.

**You're protected.** Your data is safeguarded with the highest standards.

Click [here](https://thehearthive.org/api/public/portals/v1/hearthive/env/live/siteImages/2/privacy_notice.pdf) to view the Heart Hive Privacy Policy.

sectionConfigJson.title: Together we're standing up to heart disease.
sectionConfigJson.blurb: Joining is easy. We invite all qualified participants to be a part of this collaborative research.

The Heart Hive was developed by [Dr. James Ware](https://www.imperial.ac.uk/people/j.ware) and by [Dr. Angharad Roberts](https://www.imperial.ac.uk/people/angharad.roberts) and the [Cardiovascular Genetics & Genomics Group](https://cvgenetics.org/), [Imperial College London](https://www.imperial.ac.uk/nhli).
